skills.name: Solve problems involving working out the duration between two given times
Solve problems involving adding a period of time on to a given start time
Solve problems involving subtracting a period of time from a given end time

explanations.A: Not quite - the difference from 17 to 30 is 13, but are they 13 hours?
explanations.B: Not quite - 3 minutes after 3:17 would be 3:20. Check your calculation again.
explanations.C: Close, but check your calculation - what's the difference between 30 and 17?
explanations.D: 30 - 17 = 13, so the difference between these times is 13 minutes.

explanations.A: Not quite - the difference from 9 to 30 is 21, but are they 21 hours?
explanations.B: Not quite - 11 minutes after 5:09 would be 5:20. Check your calculation again.
explanations.C: 30 - 9 = 21, so the difference between these times is 21 minutes.
explanations.D: Close, but check your calculation - what's the difference between 30 and 9?

explanations.A: I think you might have done 30 - 10, but that would be subtracting the wrong way round as 5:10 is the later time. Try counting forward from 4:30. How many minutes is it to 5pm? Then how many to 5:10?
explanations.B: Not quite - 30 minutes after 4:30 would be 5pm. How many extra minutes would get us to 5:10?
explanations.C: From 4:30 to 5:00 is 30 minutes, and from 5:00 to 5:10 is 10 minutes. Altogether, he read for 30 + 10 = 40 minutes.
explanations.D: Not quite - maybe you did 510 - 430? This doesn't work because there are 60 minutes in an hour, not 100. Try counting forward from 4:30. How many minutes is it to 5pm? Then how many to 5:10?

explanations.A: I think you might have done 30 - 20, but that would be subtracting the wrong way round as 11:20 is the later time. Try counting forward from 10:30am. How many minutes is it to 11am? Then how many to 11:20?
explanations.B: Not quite - maybe you did 11:20 - 10:30? This doesn't work because there are 60 minutes in an hour, not 100. Try counting forward from 10:30. How many minutes is it to 11am? Then how many to 11:20?
explanations.C: I think you've just looked at the hours. But this won't work because the minutes are different in the two times. Try counting forward from 10:30. How many minutes is it to 11am? Then how many to 11:20?
explanations.D: From 10:30 to 11:00 is 30 minutes, and from 11:00 to 11:20 is 20 minutes. Altogether, he read for 30 + 20 = 50 minutes.

explanations.B: We need to add 14 minutes to 8:07, not subtract, because 8:07 is the start time
explanations.C: Not quite - this would only be 4 minutes after 8:07. Check your adding, especially your carrying.
explanations.D: Careful, this one says 8:21am, but the show started at 8:07pm.

explanations.A: We need to add 14 minutes to 7:09, not subtract, because 7:09 is the start time.
explanations.C: Not quite - this would only be 4 minutes after 7:09. Check your adding, especially your carrying.
explanations.D: Careful, this one says 7:23am, but the show started at 7:09pm.

explanations.B: You have added 20 minutes, but Mary needs to finish at 7:35, not start. What time is 20 minutes before 7:35?
explanations.C: You have added 20 minutes, but Mary needs to finish at 7:35, not start. What time is 20 minutes before 7:35? Also check that the time is in the morning...
explanations.D: Careful, this one says 7:15 pm, but she is practising in the morning...

explanations.A: 40 - 15 = 25, so 15 minutes before 7:40 am is 7:25 am.
explanations.B: You have added 15 minutes, but Mary needs to finish at 7:40, not start. What time is 15 minutes before 7:40?
explanations.C: You have added 15 minutes, but Mary needs to finish at 7:40, not start. What time is 15 minutes before 7:40? Also check that the time is in the morning...
explanations.D: Careful, this one says 7:25pm, but she is practising in the morning...

explanations.A: I think you have added 18 minutes for the meeting, but what about cheerleading practice?
explanations.B: 40 minutes after 2:15 is 2:55pm. Then we can add 5 minutes to reach 3pm, and another 13 minutes to 3:13pm for the end of the meeting (5 + 13 = 18 minutes total).
explanations.C: I think you have added 40 minutes for cheerleading, but what about the meeting?
explanations.D: Almost, but remember there are 60 minutes in an hour. Can you change 73 minutes into hours and minutes, then decide what time is 73 minutes after 2pm?

explanations.A: I think you have added 22 minutes for the meeting, but what about cheerleading practice?
explanations.B: I think you have added 35 minutes for cheerleading, but what about the meeting?
explanations.C: 35 minutes after 3:20 is 3:55pm. Then we can add 5 minutes to reach 4pm, and another 17 minutes to 4:17pm for the end of the meeting (5 + 17 = 22 minutes total).
explanations.D: Almost, but remember there are 60 minutes in an hour. Can you change 77 minutes into hours and minutes, then decide what time is 77 minutes after 3pm?
